item.title: A Simple and Flexible Pytorch Video Pipeline
item.description: A Simple and Flexible Pytorch Video Pipeline # Intro # Taking machine learning models into production for video analytics doesn’t have to be hard. A pipeline with reasonable efficiency can be created very quickly just by plugging together the right libraries. In this post we’ll create a video pipeline with a focus on flexibility and simplicity using two main libraries: Gstreamer and Pytorch. Performance is out of scope for this first step, but we’ll do a deep dive in a later article.

item.title: From 10 FPS to 650 FPS: Making Deep Learning Fast
item.description: ###TODO conclusion description metadata review rules of thumb consistent end-matter with social links write an about-me write a front page output csv for regression test pytorch-video-pipeline repo README From 10 FPS to 650 FPS: Making Deep Learning Fast # Intro # Making code run fast on GPUs requires a very different approach to making code run fast on CPUs because the hardware architecture is fundamentally different.
